title: Scalable Agent-Based Modeling for Complex Financial Market Simulations
abstract: In this study, we developed a computational framework for simulating large-scale agent-based financial markets. Our platform supports trading multiple simultaneous assets and leverages distributed computing to scale the number and complexity of simulated agents. Heterogeneous agents make decisions in parallel, and their orders are processed through a realistic, continuous double auction matching engine. We present a baseline model implementation and show that it captures several known statistical properties of real financial markets (i.e., stylized facts). Further, we demonstrate these results without fitting models to historical financial data. Thus, this framework could be used for direct applications such as human-in-the-loop machine learning or to explore theoretically exciting questions about market microstructure's role in forming the statistical regularities of real markets. translated_title: 复杂金融市场模拟的可扩展的基于Agent的建模方法
translated_abstract: 在这项研究中，我们开发了一个用于模拟大规模Agent-based金融市场的计算框架。我们的平台支持交易多个同时商品，并利用分布式计算来扩展模拟代理的数量和复杂度。异质代理并行做出决策，并通过一个真实的连续双向拍卖交易引擎处理他们的订单。我们展示了一个基准模型的实现，并证明了它能捕捉到多个已知的实际金融市场统计特性（即样式化事实）。此外，我们证明了这些结果并没有将模型拟合到历史金融数据。因此，这个框架可以用于直接应用，如人类参与的机器学习，或者探索关于市场微观结构在形成实际市场统计规律方面的理论问题。据我们所知，这项研究是第一个实现多个资产和并行代理决策的。
tldr: 该论文提供了一个可扩展的Agent-based建模框架用于模拟大规模金融市场，支持交易多个同时商品，利用分布式计算来扩展模拟代理的数量和复杂度，并成功捕捉到多个实际金融市场的统计特性。
